content: Hello everyone I'm new here though and didn't know I'd be posting this soon. We have so much rules here I'm still going through then I had a question that crossed my mind although I'm pretty sure my answers already exist I'd ask again not needing reply but if you want to reply I'm grateful anywaysQuestion intended: "what is bitcoin halving? what is the historical impact on bitcoin since inception and what could be the predicted impact of the next halving?"But I decided to make use of the search button because this forum has been in existence since 2009 (correct me if I'm wrong I scrolled through the post where I saw it I didn't bother to click for more I just saw it say it has been since 2009 and it's one of the first online...). On searching for the words "Bitcoin halving" and "halving" I got a 5 page response to my search and average of response to each ¬†was over 90 replies with varying responses and links to back up their response to Bitcoin halving and so what crossed my mind was to go through a few and I'm sure I'd get answers.But again it dawned on me that there could be a repetition of question (similar questions) although the construction mat be different time to time and this could even make things more complex for readers so it's better we search for what we intend to ask before going about asking and most times our answers are already available when we searchI do not have much features to support my description but I'm sure you can navigateWhere's the search button? You may ask...*The top right hand corner of your homepage is the search button click on it and type what you want to know about or would have asked questions about *You'll be directly moved to the google search button option or forum search button option*It's nicer to use the forum search button option since google is little bit 'fuzzy' (in their words)*You again type into the search button your intended question or what you're looking for to learn about*You have options below the search to order or decide how you want your search to come in you can choose any preferable one ...you can still go ahead to search without choosing you'll get many related response that have been made as regards your search*You can click on any of the replies and read more about them to know understand what you want to learn or get answers to your intended questionI am sure that if this is done and questions still exist it will be questions that have not been asked or part of which the replies so far have not really answered...this out question becomes very important and relevant encouraging learning by others too.I'm sure you understand my point so far.Thanks to @Zaguru12 he dropped this:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5276341.0The above link simplifies my post Just discovered that even there's already replies to search so I could have as well searched search... funny right!. Thanks man!So much to know in here. Thank you all for your positive replies so far.(I guess as a newbie I should be silent and wait for "years" or "months" before posting because all I see is people digging up into timing of my registration it's laughable because your thoughts are a reflection of your behavior even to others...yeah I have lots of tips off about the forum before registering and most of my logins I've gone as far as viewing many post and I thought it needful to add this but alright I'd be quiet so as not to be ridiculed ) but it's unfair how pot calls kettle black!

comments.author: Lakai01
comments.body: Quote from: Dunamisx on August 10, 2023, 06:10:29 PM-snip-Asking about what bitcoin halving is what one can easily get an answer to either on google or from the forum search engine, but your second question is what i have an answer to, bitcoin will always increases in value after every successful halving every four years, there will be an increase in bitcoin value otherwise known as bullrun while the Bitcoin mining reward is reduced by 50% it corresponding value increases and forms a new all time high, this has been in place ever since the beginning and occurs every four years interval. Since we are here in the Beginners section of the forum I would not like to leave this statement as it is, otherwise, newcomers could read this and accept it as a God-given law. Until now it was actually like this that each Halving has also initiated the bullrun that took place about 6 to 12 months later. However, one cannot and must not conclude from the past to the future, i.e. it may well be that this is already no longer the case in for the Halving-event in 2024 ... or in one of the later following Halvings - and yes, I know that there is some evidence here in terms of market economics why Halvings trigger the bullrun, but I would still never rely on this. Until now, it was also considered an iron rule that a low of a subsequent cycle never falls below the all-time high of the last cycle. This rule was also broken in this cycle when BTC was below 16k in November last year.So: Just because one event followed another several times in the past (Halving -> Bullrun) doesn't mean that it will happen again in the future ... and this should certainly not be a reason for an investment decision.
